metadata.title: USN-5722-1 -- nginx vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that nginx incorrectly handled certain memory operations in the ngx_http_mp4_module module. A local attacker could possibly use this issue with a specially crafted mp4 file to cause nginx to crash, stop responding, or access arbitrary memory. (CVE-2022-41741, CVE-2022-41742)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5722-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libnginx-mod-stream - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-subs-filter - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 nginx-doc - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-mail - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-image-filter - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-echo - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 nginx-dev - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-nchan - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 nginx-common - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-fancyindex - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-auth-pam - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 nginx-light - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-headers-more-filter - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 nginx-extras - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-stream-geoip2 - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-upstream-fair - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-xslt-filter - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-perl - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 nginx-core - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-stream-geoip - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-dav-ext - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 nginx - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-ndk - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-uploadprogress - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-cache-purge - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 nginx-full - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-http-geoip2 - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 libnginx-mod-rtmp - 1.22.0-1ubuntu1.1 No subscription required
